Package org.cloudbus.cloudsim.allocationpolicies.vmplacementgroups

Class VmAllocationPolicyBestFitWithPlacementGroups

java.lang.Object
org.cloudbus.cloudsim.allocationpolicies.VmAllocationPolicyAbstract
org.cloudbus.cloudsim.allocationpolicies.VmAllocationPolicyBestFit
org.cloudbus.cloudsim.allocationpolicies.vmplacementgroups.VmAllocationPolicyBestFitWithPlacementGroups
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.cloudbus.cloudsim.allocationpolicies.VmAllocationPolicy
Direct Known Subclasses:
VmAllocationPolicyBestFitWithPlacementGroups_LRRL, VmAllocationPolicyChicSchedAllPack, VmAllocationPolicyFirstFitWithPlacementGroups
public class VmAllocationPolicyBestFitWithPlacementGroups extends org.cloudbus.cloudsim.allocationpolicies.VmAllocationPolicyBestFit
An extension of the VmAllocationPolicyBestFit that supports requests with VmPlacementGroups. It works in a similar way as VmAllocationPolicyBestFit by trying to place all the VMs of a request in a sequential manner (i.e., one by one). Since we try to allocate resources to groups of VMs, a request can be rejected if no resources exist for all the VMs cumulatively. The VmAllocationPolicyBestFitWithPlacementGroups considers that the hosts are connected to top-of-rack (ToR) switches and it keeps statistics about how many ToRs are used for the placement of the requests.

NOTE: As it is the case with the VmAllocationPolicyBestFit, this policy does not perform optimization of VM allocation by means of VM migration.

Since:
CloudSim Plus 7.3.2
Author:
Pavlos Maniotis

    • VmAllocationPolicyBestFitWithPlacementGroups

      public VmAllocationPolicyBestFitWithPlacementGroups(org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.CloudSim simulation, TracesSimulationManager simulationManager)
      Takes as input the CloudSim and TracesSimulationManager and performs basic checks about the number of hosts per switch. See TracesSimulationManager for more information about how to run this kind of trace-based simulations.
      Parameters:
      simulation - a handle to the CloudSim object
      simulationManager - see TracesSimulationManager

  • Method Details

    • allocateHostForVm

      public org.cloudbus.cloudsim.hosts.HostSuitability allocateHostForVm(org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm vm)
      It overrides the VmAllocationPolicyAbstract.allocateHostForVm(Vm) in order to provide support for VmPlacementGroup requests. It handles also the update of the statistics through the TracesStatisticsManager and it updates the LOGGER with messages about the placement of the requested resources.
      Specified by:
      allocateHostForVm in interface org.cloudbus.cloudsim.allocationpolicies.VmAllocationPolicy
      Overrides:
      allocateHostForVm in class org.cloudbus.cloudsim.allocationpolicies.VmAllocationPolicyAbstract
      Parameters:
      vm - the Vm or VmGroup to allocate a host to
      Returns:
      a HostSuitability to indicate if the Vm was placed into the host or not (if the Host doesn't have enough resources to allocate the Vm)
      See Also:
      • VmGroup

    • findAndAllocateHostsForVmPlacementGroup

      protected boolean findAndAllocateHostsForVmPlacementGroup(VmPlacementGroup vmPlacementGroup)
      Tries to find one or more hosts to allocate resources for the VMs of a VmPlacementGroup. Temporary VMs are used as placeholders in order to check if all VMs can be placed successfully. If yes, the temporary VMs are replaced by the actual VMs of the VmPlacementGroup. Otherwise, the temporary VMs are destroyed.
      Parameters:
      vmPlacementGroup - the requested VmPlacementGroup
      Returns:
      true if all VMs are placed successfully or false otherwise.

    • createTempToRealVmsMap

      protected Map<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm,org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm> createTempToRealVmsMap(VmPlacementGroup vmPlacementGroup)
      Takes as input a VmPlacementGroup and returns a Map with temporary to real VM associations for the VMs of the group.
      Parameters:
      vmPlacementGroup - the VmPlacementGroup for which we want to create temporary VMs
      Returns:
      the Map with the temporary to real VM associations

    • replaceTempVmsWithRealVms

      protected void replaceTempVmsWithRealVms(Map<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm,org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm> tempToRealVms, Map<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm,org.cloudbus.cloudsim.hosts.Host> tempVmsToHosts)
      Takes as input a Map with the temporary to real VM associations and a Map with the temporary VMs to host associations (hosts that have used to place them). It replaces the temporary VMs with the real VMs, while the temporary VMs are destroyed.
      Parameters:
      tempToRealVms - the temporary to real VM associations
      tempVmsToHosts - the temporary VMs and the hosts have been used to place them

    • destroyCreatedTempVms

      protected void destroyCreatedTempVms(Map<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm,org.cloudbus.cloudsim.hosts.Host> tempVmsToHosts)
      Takes as input a Map with temporary VMs to hosts associations and destroys the VMs to free up the allocated resources.
      Parameters:
      tempVmsToHosts - the temporary VMs to host associations

    • findHostForTempVm

      private Optional<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.hosts.Host> findHostForTempVm(org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm tempVm)
      Finds a suitable host that has enough resources to place a temporary VM. Internally it may use a default implementation or one set in runtime. The host is not set to active status because the resources are allocated to a temporary VM.
      Parameters:
      tempVm - the temporary VM for which we try to allocate resources to
      Returns:
      an Optional containing a suitable Host to place the VM or an empty Optional if no suitable Host was found
